definition[0]: to do something or go somewhere more quickly than usual, especially because there is not much time
example[0]: If we hurry, we’ll get there in time.
example[1]: I hate having to hurry a meal.
example[2]: We’ll have to hurry, otherwise we’ll miss the start.
example[3]: There’s no need to hurry. We’ve got plenty of time.
example[4]: They were hurrying to catch their train.
example[5]: She hurried down the corridor as fast as she could.
definition[1]: to make someone do something more quickly
example[7]: Don’t hurry me. I’m doing this as fast as I can.
example[8]: She doesn’t want to be hurried into making a decision.
definition[2]: to take someone or something quickly to a place
example[9]: Emergency supplies have been hurried to the areas worst hit by the famine.
definition[3]: to go somewhere or do something more quickly than usual, for example because you are late or you must finish something soon
example[10]: If you don’t hurry, you’ll miss the bus.
example[11]: We have plenty of time. There’s no need to hurry.
definition[4]: to go somewhere very quickly, or to do something too quickly and without thinking carefully enough
example[12]: Everyone rushed out into the street to see what was happening.
example[13]: Try to answer the questions calmly, without rushing.
definition[5]: to go somewhere very quickly, especially because there is something important or urgent you must do
example[15]: I’ve got to dash to the shops to get some more milk.
example[16]: She had to dash off and get the kids from school.
definition[6]: doing something quickly because you do not have much time, usually with the result that you make mistakes
example[17]: She had left in a hurry, and forgotten her passport.
example[18]: I had to choose a present for her in a rush.
definition[7]: to start to do something or go somewhere more quickly than before
example[19]: Get a move on – it’s already 8 o'clock!
example[20]: I think we’d better get moving, it’s only five minutes to boarding time.
example[21]: It’s time you got cracking with your homework.
example[22]: When Alfie arrives we’ll get cracking moving the furniture.
